Whether not using auth is a good idea I don't know - but I have never had an issue.  I remember trying to set it up but I couldn't get it to work back then and I had to have the webhook up and running fairly quickly - I probably should revisit that.
Create a private app and that will give you an api key based on the scopes you set.  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps>

Hello everyone,
I want to implement an approach where I get associations between different objects in bulk. For example, I pass a list of deals and want to receive a list of associated companies.

The method signature looks like this:
```def fetch_associations_bulk(user_id, object_type, association_type, deal_ids):
    url = f"<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/associations/{object_type}/{association_type}/batch/read>"
    payload = {
        "inputs": [{"id": deal_id} for deal_id in deal_ids]
    }```
There are cases when there are no associated companies with deals, and the API returns an error:
`"errors":[{"status":"error","category":"OBJECT_NOT_FOUND","message":"Could not get some COMPANY objects, they may be deleted or not exist. Check that ids are valid.",}`

API returns some companies, but when it faces an error, it stops, so I receive a limited response.

What is the efficient way to handle that?
